title: Synthetic Recap
body:
By The Associated Press

AUBURN HILLS, Mich. – The stat sheet will record it as a 96-92 victory for the Philadelphia 76ers over the Detroit Pistons. But the history books will remember it as the night Allen Iverson announced his arrival to the world.

In a breathtaking, virtuoso performance, the rookie phenom from Georgetown detonated for a staggering 50 points, single-handedly carrying his team to a gritty road win and etching his name into the annals of the league. On a night where his team needed every last ounce of his brilliance, Iverson delivered a historic masterpiece.

From the opening tip, it was clear Iverson was operating on a different plane. He was a blur of crossover dribbles and fearless forays into the lane, slicing through the Pistons' defense with an audacity that belied his years. While Detroit’s Grant Hill countered with a stellar 31-point, 10-rebound effort of his own, it was merely a supporting role in the Iverson epic.

The game hung in the balance throughout the final minutes, a back-and-forth struggle where every possession was magnified. And every time the 76ers needed a bucket to quell a Pistons run, the ball found its way into Iverson’s hands. He answered every challenge, his lightning-quick drives and pull-up jumpers silencing the Auburn Hills crowd. He didn't just score; he imposed his will.

When the final horn sounded, the reality of his achievement settled over the arena: 50 points for a player just beginning his career. It was more than a win; it was a declaration. The Philadelphia 76ers left Detroit with two points in the standings, but their young guard left with immortality, a 50-point promise of a legend in the making.
